1000: Hmmph. You're not a guild member.  I really shouldn't give out jobs  to non-members. However, I have  something that I need done that  I don't really want anyone else  in the guild to find out about.  If you do this for me for free,  I'll spread it around that you  are our kind of %ra. What  do you say %pcf?
1002: My name is _questgiver_.  There is an ancient text supposedly  hidden in ___dungeon_.  Bring it back to me within =traveltime_ days  and I'll consider the job done.
1004: Excellent. I remembered to warn you not  to read this, didn't I?  Could be quite  dangerous if you pronounced "nagog" with  the hard g, as laymen are apt.  Well, thanks for  your help, %pcn. Keep this up  and we'll consider you for membership  in the Mages Guild.
1005: I got a boil the other day ... but it healed.
I just had a three hour conversation about the weather.
The weather is pretty usual for this time of year.
It seems a trifle coolish in %cn for this time of year.
It sure is a lot warmer today than this time last year.
My great aunt is going to a specialist across the Bay.
It's always funny what time it gets dark around here.
We should erect a war statue around here.
The kids these days with their magic. %oth, I don't know.
I had the weirdest dream last night.
%jok Can you explain that to me?
The legal system in %reg has some good points and bad ones.

1008: Certainly I remember you, %pcf. You brought me that text, right?
1009: I can't imagine a simpler assignment than  the one I gave you -- just find a rare old  scroll. Now, I can't imagine a reason why  I should keeping talking to you.
1010: %qdt: I met _questgiver_ of the Mages Guild of ___questgiver_ who sent me on a quest to find an ancient text hidden in ___dungeon_. I have =traveltime_ days to get it to %g2.
1020: Zephrim alga n' nagog. Carti alga n' belyl. Azuth Zephrim ne' nagog. Partik aloy partik frae i eyominathraq n' toyl. Berik azuth n' nagog. Charlaq gimle n' maluk Zephrim qork.
1040: This must be the parchment  _questgiver_ sent you to find.
1045: As you read the final word,  a frigid blast almost whirls  the paper out of your hands.
